abstract: Bloodhound named Nathan, winner of recent National Dog Show, comes close to winning best in show at Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show for second consecutive year, coming in second behind beagle Miss P; bloodhound, like majority of breeds entered in show, has never won Westminster's top prize.
lead_paragraph: Nathan, a dog who was trying to become the first bloodhound to win the Best of Show prize, failed to defend his hound group title. He finished second to Miss P, a beagle.

headline.main: Westminster Dog Show Offers No Joy for Fans of a Charming Galoot
headline.print_headline: Disappointment for the Fans of a Charming Galoot

snippet: Nathan, a dog who was trying to become the first bloodhound to win the Best of Show prize, failed to defend his hound group title. He finished second to Miss P, a beagle.
